verses.verse: Keep<WH8104> your foot<WH7272> when you go<WH3212> to the house<WH1004> of God<WH430>, and be more ready<WH7138> to hear<WH8085>, than to give<WH5414> the sacrifice<WH2077> of fools<WH3684>: for they consider<WH3045> not that they do<WH6213> evil<WH7451>.

Be not rash<WH926> with your mouth<WH6310>, and let not your heart<WH3820> be hasty<WH4116> to utter<WH3318> any thing<WH1697> before<WH6440> God<WH430>: for God<WH430> is in heaven<WH8064>, and you upon earth<WH776>: therefore let your words<WH1697> be few<WH4592>.
For a dream<WH2472> comes<WH935> through the multitude<WH7230> of business<WH6045>; and a fool<WH3684>'s voice<WH6963> is known by multitude<WH7230> of words<WH1697>.
When you vow<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto God<WH430>, defer<WH309> not to pay<WH7999> it<WH2656>; for he has no pleasure in fools<WH3684>: pay<WH7999> that which you have vowed<WH5087>.
Better<WH2896> is it that you should not vow<WH5087>, than that you should vow<WH5087> and not pay<WH7999>.

Allow<WH5414> not your mouth<WH6310> to cause your flesh<WH1320> to sin<WH2398>; neither say<WH559> you before<WH6440> the angel<WH4397>, that it was a error<WH7684>: therefore should God<WH430> be angry<WH7107> at your voice<WH6963>, and destroy<WH2254> the work<WH4639> of your hands<WH3027>?
For in the multitude<WH7230> of dreams<WH2472> and many<WH7235> words<WH1697> there are also various vanities<WH1892>: but fear<WH3372> you God<WH430>.

If you see<WH7200> the oppression<WH6233> of the poor<WH7326>, and violent<WH1499> perverting of judgment<WH4941> and justice<WH6664> in a province<WH4082>, marvel<WH8539> not at the matter<WH2656>: for he that is higher<WH1364> than the highest<WH1364> watches<WH8104>; and there be higher<WH1364> than they<WH5921>.
Moreover the profit<WH3504> of the earth<WH776> is for all<WH4428>: the king himself is served<WH5647> by the field<WH7704>.
He that loves<WH157> silver<WH3701> shall not be satisfied<WH7646> with silver<WH3701>; nor he that loves<WH157> abundance<WH1995> with increase<WH8393>: this is also vanity<WH1892>.

When goods<WH2896> increase<WH7235>, they are increased<WH7231> that eat<WH398> them<WH3788>: and what good is there to the owners<WH1167> there<WH518>, except the beholding<WH7207> of them with their eyes<WH5869>?

The sleep<WH8142> of a laboring man<WH5647> is sweet<WH4966>, whether he eat<WH398> little<WH4592> or much<WH7235>: but the abundance<WH7647> of the rich<WH6223> will not allow<WH3240> him to sleep<WH3462>.
There is<WH3426> a severe<WH2470> evil<WH7451> which I have seen<WH7200> under the sun<WH8121>, namely<WH6239>, riches kept<WH8104> for the owners<WH1167> to their hurt<WH7451>.
But those riches<WH6239> perish<WH6> by evil<WH7451> hardship<WH6045>: and he fathers<WH3205> a son<WH1121>, and there is nothing<WH3972> in his hand<WH3027>.

As he came forth<WH3318> of his mother<WH517>'s womb<WH990>, naked<WH6174> shall he return<WH7725> to go<WH3212> as he came<WH935>, and shall take<WH5375> nothing<WH3972> of his labor<WH5999>, which he may carry away<WH3212> in his hand<WH3027>.

And this<WH2090> also is a severe<WH2470> evil<WH7451>, that in all points<WH5980> as he came<WH935>, so shall he go<WH3212>: and what profit<WH3504> has he that has labored<WH5998> for the wind<WH7307>?
All his days<WH3117> also he eat<WH398> in darkness<WH2822>, and he has much<WH7235> sorrow<WH3707> and wrath<WH7110> with his sickness<WH2483>.

Behold that which I have seen<WH7200>: it is good<WH2896> and fitting<WH3303> for one to eat<WH398> and to drink<WH8354>, and to enjoy<WH7200> the good<WH2896> of all his labor<WH5999> that he takes<WH5998> under the sun<WH8121> all<WH4557> the days<WH3117> of his life<WH2416>, which God<WH430> gives<WH5414> him<WH2506>: for it is his portion.

Every man<WH120> also to whom God<WH430> has given<WH5414> riches<WH6239> and wealth<WH5233>, and has given him power<WH7980> to eat<WH398> there<WH5375>, and to take his portion<WH2506>, and to rejoice<WH8055> in his labor<WH5999>; this<WH2090> is the gift<WH4991> of God<WH430>.
For he shall not much<WH7235> remember<WH2142> the days<WH3117> of his life<WH2416>; because God<WH430> answers<WH6031> him in the joy<WH8057> of his heart<WH3820>.
